STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
December 30, 2024
Rebecca Stowell
INGHAM COUNTY YOUTH CENTER
700 E JOLLY RD,
LANSING, MI, 48910-6832
Re: License #: CO330201191
Dear Annette Ellison:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 10/30/2024. The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance with
applicable licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be receiving
the license in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable. If
you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Nabiha Rizk, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• All employee references letters need to be dated.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• The facility did not require or request consultation at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on a review of the facility’s budget
and the agency financial audit
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable
Chief Administrator Assessment
Not Applicable
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviews were conducted, and staff noted feeling supported by
management, adequate training, and having the tools needed to do their job.
Chief Administrator reported Staff reported the facility has been focusing on more
trauma informed care for the youth they serve, and staff retention.

Three youths were interviewed during the inspection. They reported feeling safe at
the facility, all their needs are being met, and having a positive relationship with
staff.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An on-site inspection and walkthrough of the facility occurred on 10/30/2024
observed the units, gym, the youths' bedrooms, shower area, medication room,
control rooms, and classrooms. There were no issues or safety concerns noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
12/29/2024
